txt.en: Gadorgar
'We must complete our planning today, lest some ploy of the Enemy throws us astray.'
'Lomdognir, is this camp now safe from prying eyes?'
'Do not speak overloud, but yes, we have secured these ruins.'
Malledhrim Sentinel
'While some goblins yet lurk about, the guard is sufficient to keep them at bay.'
'Very well.'
'As I speak, our assault on the encampment of Gathbúrz is beginning on the slopes above us.'
Romloth
'These are the outer barracks of Dol Guldur and poorly protected compared to the tower itself.'
'And the assault on the tower itself? When shall it begin?'
'There will be no such assault, save for a feint to draw the eyes of the tower and keep their gates sealed.'
'My command she might disregard as the buzzing of a summer fly, but not her brother's words.'
'When it comes time, he will see to it that she withdraws in good order.'
'And if Handelen should fall to an unlucky arrow? What then?'
'I imagine that she would strive to set Dol Guldur aflame if she had to place every tree of Lórien about its base as a bonfire to do so.'
'But let us not dwell on unfortunate possibilites.'
'Fate has been kind to us thus far, let us not tempt it further.'
'Agorin, you have been in contact with Ivorel recently, have you not?'
'Yes. At the moment she and several of her scouts range through the Scuttledells to the north.'
'A few more of her people are south of here, keeping an eye upon the Orcs in Taur Morvith.'
Bruinir
Crisgyl
'She may take it into her mind to assault Dol Guldur directly....'
'Even if she commanded nothing save her own two hands and a sword between them.'
Malledhrim Soldier
'Is she as mad as stories say, then? I have heard many, and not all of them kind.'
'Very good! I believe your prowess has improved of late, my friend.'
'It is said she is of striking, though distant, descent of he who stood in challenge before very gates of our ancient Enemy and fell there alone.'
Malledhrim Soldier
Tathoron
'It would seem then that she takes his example to heart.'
'Our plan calls for a retreat to the safety of Lórien before the main host of the Enemy arrives.'
'How will you restrain our fire-blooded Champion then, Fuirgam?'
'Rodelleth is not mad -- though it is true that her pride could likely support all the boughs of Lórien.'
'Yet calm Handelen stands at her side as tactician.'
'He shall advise her in the goals of Lórien when her heat blinds her.'
'Some evil sorcery is clearly at work within Minas Gil, but I do not yet know enough of its nature.'
'We must find some way to put an end to it soon, or it will likely be turned against us.'
'I am counting on you, Agorin. You are the wisest among us when it comes to the sorceries of the Enemy.'
'I have some hope that I will soon unravel its mysteries.'
'I will let you know when I have solved this riddle.'
'Does she have anything to report?'
'Little, I am afraid. The Scuttledells are even more difficult to navigate than she feared....'
'Though the Orcs likewise seem loath to venture there.'
'The spiders that infest the area do not care who their prey might be.'
'And Taur Morvith?'
'The Orcs there are disorganized and bereft of leadership from Dol Guldur.'
Bariel
'They seem intent on defending their camps, but no more for the time being.'
'We have no report from the scouts that have crept south of the river yet.'
'What of that strange tower on the slope above us? Our soldiers have been unable to enter it.'
'You have been studying that since we arrived, have you not?'
Lassil
'I am not of militant upbringing, but this seems folly to me.'
'Why do we expose our forces in this way when we could hold the advantage of the river between us?'
'Normally I would agree with you, Agorin...'
'But the Lady has espied a great army gathering in the East. Even now it marches through Mirkwood.'
'Its numbers dwarf the garrison of Dol Guldur, and there is little doubt that it shall march on Lórien.'
'Celeborn holds that with the destruction of Gathbúrz, we shall buy precious time and confound the Enemy's plans to assault us.'
'The loss of supplies, barracks, and the engines of war they had prepared will weaken them when they attempt the Anduin.'
Lovellos
'Yet our losses here shall weaken us, while the Enemy's numbers only grow!'
'It is a gamble true enough, and there may be more to it than any here know....'
'What is this, Fuirgam? What do you mean by that? You have said nothing of this before now.'
Crafting Hall
'So Fuirgam, who did you decide upon to spearhead the assault upon Gathbúrz?'
'You spoke of some difficulty in the choice when last we met.'
'The assault proceeds beneath the banner of Rodelleth, Champion of the Malledhrim.'
'Rodelleth? Her reputation precedes her, but she seems an indelicate choice.'
'These are indelicate times, Agorin. We have a need for thunder and fury upon that hill.'
'Our main goal is to destroy the barracks at Gathbúrz.'
'Capacities in which our dear Rodelleth is eminently qualified.'
'But... but why? Why risk so many brave Elves for just this? All those who died at the landing....'
'Besides, these may well be our last great battles in Middle-earth....'
'They will not have been in vain, Agorin.'
'It would hardly seem fair to deny her this opportunity.'
'Forgive me, in the rush you were not made privy to Lord Celeborn's counsel.'
'Putting jests to the side, Fuirgam, Rodelleth may be a brilliant warrior, but she will bear the weight of no leash.'
'Lomdognir, if you would?'
'Of course.... My lady Agorin, I shall relate his mind to you, as I know it.'
'Lord Celeborn has bidden us cross the Anduin in order to lay siege to Dol Guldur and forestall the Enemy's assault.'
'So I was made to understand, but you now say otherwise and confuse my purpose!'
'Our actual goal is the destruction of the barracks at Gathbúrz, where a great many Orcs might be housed and supplied.'
'We have neither the force nor the equipment to reduce the tower itself, even with just the garrison defending it.'
'What that is, I do not know.'
'I think I can guess that -- Our visitors of late, who have had council with the Lord and Lady....'
'Your perceptions are keen, Agorin, but I think we now discuss matters which are best left unexplored.'
'Agreed. Had Lord Celeborn wished us to know his mind in these matters, he would have spoken clearly.'
'Then let us speak of it no more. Now, back to mundane matters....'
'I have known Lord Celeborn for many years, and there was hesitation in his eyes as he gave me these orders.'
'Not the hesitation of fear or uncertainty, but that of words which could not be spoken.'
'What do you mean by this? Speak clearly, if you may.'
'I believe there is another goal to our assault, known to the Lord and Lady alone.'
'A matter of such import that they could not tell us of it.'
'What matter could possibly possess more importance than the defence of Lórien?'
'Indeed Fuirgam, what secret purpose do we fight for if not our home?'
'I cannot be sure, but more than once Lord Celeborn spoke of drawing the eyes of the tower with this assault.'
'I think he meant the Nazgûl within. At least two have been spotted, upon dread flying beasts.'
'But such a feint suggests that there is something that one does not wish one's opponent to see.'
Ivoron
